name: Kadin Buddu Kofta (Turkish Meatballs)
author: Zainab Pervaiz
summary: Simple, but very tasty! One of my favorite Turkish foods. Literally, kadin buddu means 'ladies' thighs.' Coated in egg and then fried, Turkish koftas come in all shapes, sizes, and degrees of spiciness. You can do a lot with them. Serve with breads, rice, sauces, gravies, salads, and onion rings, or serve them as-is for an appetizer or snack.
ingredients: ¼ cup oil, or more as needed
directions: Combine ground lamb, cooked rice, salt, garam masala, and ground black pepper in a bowl
Transfer mixture to a food processor and pulse until combined, 1 to 2 times
Shape mixture into 10 meatballs about 2 inches in diameter
Beat egg in a small bowl
Pour flour onto a shallow dish
Dip meatballs in the beaten egg; dredge in flour
Heat oil in a large skillet
Cook meatballs until golden on all sides, about 10 minutes
